usage_notes: Very versatile verb in Quebec. Can mean to catch, grab, get, or understand. Ex: 'Je pogne pas' (I don't get it)
More common in Quebec than 'se plaindre'. Has a stronger connotation of whining
Standard verb for shopping in Quebec, whereas in France they use 'faire les courses' or 'faire du shopping'
Can also mean to make fun of someone. Ex: 'Arrête de niaiser!' (Stop fooling around!)
Informal. Often used for casual conversation or gossip. Ex: 'On a placoté toute la soirée'
